question: 核
sourceAnswer: stone-(of-a-fruit)/pit/pip | core-(of-an-organization,-team,-etc.)/nucleus/heart | nuclear-weapons | nucleus-(of-an-atom) | nucleus-(of-a-cell) | condensation-nucleus | (planetary)-core | ring-(in-a-cyclic-compound) | kernel/core | nucleus-(of-a-cultured-pearl)
activeAnswer: stone-(of-a-fruit)/pit/pip | core-(of-an-organization,-team,-etc.)/nucleus/heart | nuclear-weapons | nucleus-(of-an-atom) | nucleus-(of-a-cell) | condensation-nucleus | (planetary)-core | ring-(in-a-cyclic-compound) | kernel/core | nucleus-(of-a-cultured-pearl)
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are the same. That means they share meanings as well. This word can also mean <vocabulary>core</vocabulary> because that's where the nucleus is in a cell, and <vocabulary>nuclear</vocabulary> because we like to blow ourselves up nowadays...
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the kanji reading you learned.
